file_content.text: Sometimes good people die.
Just tell me what you want.
Hey! Hold up a minute. I need to talk to you before you go.
I know what you and Asara did down in engineering. How could you just kill all of those people?
You don't know that! You can't have possibly known that!
That's it? That's all you can say for yourself?
Nobody wanted this to happen. But we had to get the bridge open, or else everyone would've died.
I'm sorry.
If we survive this at all, it will be because of me.
Don't question me.
We're the only reason anyone on this ship is still breathing, Haken.
Don't question us.
I've been flying with Salen for ten years, do you understand?
Seems you and Asara will sacrifice anyone and anything. Well, if you ask me, there's only one sacrifice that needs to be made to keep this ship safe.
I just talked to Salen from engineering. He told me what Asara tried to make you do down there. Thank you for stopping her.
She was just doing what she thought she had to do to save the ship.
Asara had good intentions.
Sacrificing innocent people is wrong, no matter the reason.
I just did what seemed right.
And she would've killed a lot of good people if you hadn't stopped her. Thank you.
I can't believe that woman is an ambassador. She's as cold as they come.
Asara had to be stopped.
You stood up for the lives of my crew, and risked your own instead. I won't forget that.
I'm glad I'm not the only one who's noticed.
What are you suggesting, Haken?
I don't understand.
Listen, I've been thinking. I really believe this plan is going to work.
But there's only one way to guarantee that we all make it home safe. And that's to make sure the Imperials have no reason to keep chasing us.
You want me to hand the ambassador over to the Imperials, don't you?
This is about Asara, isn't it?
Yes. For the sake of us all, I want you to leave Asara behind on the Grand Moff's ship.
I want you to leave Asara on the Grand Moff's ship.
With the tractor beam down, we'll be able to escape. But Kilran will just chase us down again--unless he's already captured his target.
Asara is the reason for all of this. If you're serious about doing whatever it takes to save this ship, then you'll make sure she doesn't come back with you.
You may be right about this, Haken.
I'll consider it.
I know I'm right. And I'll be sure you get a suitable reward if you side with me.
As long as Asara is on this ship, everyone aboard is in danger. I don't know about you, but I'm tired of risking all of our lives for that woman.
I didn't sacrifice the engineers to get us out of this. I won't sacrifice Asara, either.
I won't leave her to die.
My judgement isn't clouded. This is what has to be done, I'm sure of it.
I'm not interested in high ideals, Jedi. I'm interested in getting people home safe.
Don't let your anger at the ambassador cloud your judgment.
Don't go down that path.
Ambassador Asara is a Republic official. It's our duty to protect her.
What you suggest is treason.
Freedom is meaningless if it's bought with treachery.
We can't become our enemies.
Is this really what's best for the ship? Or are you just looking for a bit of payback?
You're just angry.
Maybe. Doesn't change the fact that leaving her behind will save the rest of us.
Just think about it. I'd even make it worth your while if things go the way I'm suggesting.
It's going to be dangerous over there. If Asara didn't make it, nobody would even think twice about it.
Leaving Asara behind ensures the safety of everyone else on the ship.
I couldn't agree more.
Anyway, you'd better get going--I've held you up too long already. Good luck.
I'm glad we're on the same page, here. And I'm going to make sure you get rewarded for your help in this.
